b2s_clf.sampler package¶

Submodules¶

b2s_clf.sampler.sampler module¶

class b2s_clf.sampler.sampler.Sampler[source]¶

Bases: object

combine_samplings(new_sampling)[source]¶

Adds the batches present in a second sampling to current sampling object. The second sampling must have been generated with the same input and output variables. Note that this will only check that the names match, the user will still have to make sure that the data is compatible or makes sense. :param new_sampling: Sampling object containing the batches to add.

Returns:

extract_batch(index, y=False)[source]¶

Retrieve the numpy.ndarray stored in a particular batch. :param index: Index of the particular batch to extract. :param y: If true, will retrieve the target vector.

Returns

numpy.ndarray containing the batch.

generate_batches(df, n_batches, batch_len, target_variable, input_variables=None, balanced=True, resample=True, verbose=True)[source]¶

Generates batches from a pandas.DataFrame. Note that this will overwrite any existing batches. :param df: pandas.DataFrame from which to sample. :param n_batches: Total number of batches to generate. :param batch_len: Length of each batch. :param target_variable: User-defined target variable. :param input_variables: User-defined input variable list. If None, will simply take df column names. :param balanced: Whether to balance the batches by target_variable. :param resample: Whether to sample batches with replacement. :param verbose: Whether to print progress on screen.

Returns:

load_sampling(path, sampling_name)[source]¶

Will attempt to load an exsiting sampling from a local file. :param path: Path to file. :param sampling_name: File name without extension.

Returns:

save_sampling(path, sampling_name, mode='pickle')[source]¶

Will save a dictionary into a local path with generated batches :param path: Directory to store the output file. :param sampling_name: Output file name. :param mode: pickle or json

Returns:
